sense.name: Educate or teach (about), either by experience or instruction.
sense.examples: War schooled them in pain and suffering. Her mother schooled her in poetry and music. He schooled himself in Southern history. The company schooled each of its employees in the art of time management.

sense.name: Swim in or form a group, as a large group of fish might.
sense.commentary: Includes: SCHOOL TOGETHER Syntax Is: NP1[agent] SCHOOL Note: May be metaphorical.
sense.examples: The fish schooled together as the sharks closed in. Preschoolers tend to school together on the playground. Scientists school on topics they don't understand, producing no new research.

sense.name: Dominate, as in a sporting activity; instruct specifically by trouncing in competition.
sense.examples: Jordan really schooled an opponent last game. Man, you got schooled! She kicked your butt! Tommy schooled me during one-on-one.
